definition: in arithmetic of subtraction, to borrow 10 and carry from the next place
to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)
position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: The naive approach would be to implement subtraction with borrowing.
sentences.chinese: 简单版本的方法就是要用借位的减法。

definition: to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
to carry sb the way grooms carry brides across the threshold

(TV or movie) blooper/continuity error/(theater) to flub one's lines/unintended exposure of a body part/to be exposed (of a scheme or trick)/to reveal sth one intended to conceal through a slip of the tongue/to blow one's cover
to check on sb at his workplace/to come to a movie set to visit one of the actors
stand-in/substitute/body double/stuntman/scapegoat/fall guy/to stand in for sb else
substitute actor (esp. in fights of theatrical stunts)/stuntman
